intro: Lettsomia calcicola, commonly known as the calcicola lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and compact, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
